Title: ‘Lekki port’s model should be replicated nationwide’
Summary: The Managing Director of Lekki Port LFTZ Enterprise Limited, Mr Wang Qiang, urged policymakers and stakeholders to replicate the deep seaport’s model nationwide . Title: MAN charges govt to protect local industries in airport fencing contract
Summary: The Director-General of the Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN), Segun Ajayi-Kadir, has urged the Federal Government to re-examine the ongoing procurement process for the Murtala Muhammed International Airport, Lagos, Operational Perimeter Fencing and Security Surveillance project .

Title: SEREC rejects 2,000% hike in Customs licensing fees, recommends 85%
Summary: SEREC rejects 2,000% hike in Customs licensing fees, recommends 85% . SEREC urges Nigeria Customs Service to adopt a more balanced and solution-driven framework to its licensing fees for port operators .

Title: Mauritius, Rwanda lead Africa in public sector effectiveness
Summary: The 2025 Chandler Good Government Index (CGGI) has identified Mauritius as the leading government in Africa, followed by Rwanda and Botswana . Mauritius, Rwanda lead Africa in public sector effectiveness, says CGGI .

Title: College launches TETFund Blackboard LMS solution
Summary: The Kaduna State College of Education has officially launched the TETFund Blackboard Learning Management System (LMS) The College has completed the successful completion of its on-campus training sponsored by TEFund .

Title: NASO debunks reports of EFCC probe over unpaid royalties
Summary: National Association of Stevedore Operators (NASO) debunks reports of EFCC probe over unpaid royalties . No individual or group, including stevedores, has the right to withhold government dues, taxes, or taxes .

Title: The supreme powers of the President, by Eric Teniola
Summary: Olusegun Obasanjo (88) delayed signing the Proclamation of the first sitting of the National Assembly . Subsection 3 of Section 64 of the 1999 Constitution states that: “Subject to the provisions of this Constitution, the President, has the supreme powers of the President .

Title: Man beats wife to death in Ekiti
Summary: Modupe Alasin was mercilessly beaten by her husband in Efon Alaaye, Ekiti State over lateness to farm . A woman simply identified as Modupe Alin has died .

Title: PDP’s 2027 zoning to South is Wike’s ‘done deal’ for Tinubu’s re-election – Dele Momodu
Summary: Dele Momodu has condemned the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) over its decision to zone the 2027 presidential ticket to Southern Nigeria . PDP's 2027 zoning to South is Wike’s ‘done deal’ for Tinubu’�s re-election – Dele .

Title: Trump slaps 50% tariffs on Indian goods over Russian oil purchase
Summary: The United States has enacted sweeping 50% tariffs on a broad range of Indian exports . The move has sharply escalated tensions between the two strategic partners . The tariffs could slash export orders by 30%, delivering a severe shock to India’s small and medium-sized exporters .

Title: Kazakhstan’s Kairat Almaty stun Celtic, book first-ever Champions League spot

Title: Tinubu meets NGX, SEC chiefs in Brazil, hails capital market gains
Summary: President Bola Tinubu on Tuesday praised the “remarkable growth” of Nigeria’s capital market under his administration . This is as he credited investors’ confidence in his economic reforms for the surge in activity on the Nigerian Exchange . Title: IG obtains order to scrutinise Sowore’s bank accounts
Summary: Omoyele Sowore is under investigation for alleged terrorism financing, money laundering, and other fraudulent activities . At least 26 bank accounts linked to him, including those operated by Sahara Reporters Media Foundation and the African Action Congress, are reportedly under probe . Title: Convicted Army General forfeits N5bn shares in 17 companies
Summary: Federal High Court in Lagos orders final forfeiture of 245,568,137 shares, worth over N5bn, traced to Maj. Gen. Umar Mohammed . The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission alleged that the shares were acquired with proceeds of unlawful activities during Mohammed’s leadership of Nigerian Army Properties Limited .
